ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This is an important class for students interested in the economics and markets of extractives. Unfortunately, Prof. Jaffe's course was less than optimally organized and presented.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: I love that FES ran a course like this this year. I learned a lot from listening to Amy's anecdotal stories about her experience in the oil and gas industry. We had some great class discussions.
The linkage between oil and gas and the cleantech industry.
Lectures and readings on the oil markets were the best

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think the organization of the course could use a bit more thought - it was a bit all over the place.
More organized lecture content and preparation.

I wish we spent more time on the oil and gas industry, instead of mixing up different topics that we only scratched the surface of such as corporate sustainability. In the FES curriculum there is a gap for the oil and gas knowledge whereas other areas are well covered.
Clarity of explanations and course structure.
Lectures and readings on the oil markets were the best. The lectures on sustainability and clean tech are less of the professor's forte. I would recommend focusing more on oil and gas.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The readings were helpful, but we could have discussed them more in class. Too often the instructor would go off topic instead of talk about the subject matter.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course was great for me, coming from forestry and never having taken a course in oil and gas economics and having no real understanding of how the oil markets function. I think we need more stuff like this at FES!

There are not enough courses at F&ES that talk about oil and global markets. It is incredibly relevant for out field. I learned more in this 6-week course than I learned in most other courses I have taken so far at F&ES.
I do not regret taking the class, but still feel I could have put my time to better use.
I am strongly interested in energy transition and this course as well as professor are excellent resources for that.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Same reason as Question 17.
It was a rare opportunity to learn from a a seasoned expert on oil markets.
Because I wanted to learn more about oil and gas, and the energy markets in general.
Because of my strong interest in energy transition and the important aspects this class dealt with.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes and no. I think it was a great class and I enjoyed the discussions and hearing Amy's stories, but it was a bit disorganized.
Not really. Some class sessions were very broad discussions without necessarily covering a lot of the material.
Somewhat. I did learn important material related to oil and gas markets.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Just go with the flow and glean what you can from the group discussions; also, realize Amy is such an incredible intellectual resource and set up some time with her outside of class to chat.
It is great to have visting professors,but I would incorporate some of students' feedback in the future and bring on professors that will meet the expectations of the students.
Ask for clear structure during the weeks of the course and ask at the beginning for specific things you would want to address within the class.
